title: 106_s1707
content: The Tennessee Valley Authority is recognized as an establishment under the Inspector General Act of 1978, emphasizing the importance of Inspectors General in preventing fraud, waste, and abuse in the Federal Government. The Act is amended to include the Board of Directors of the Tennessee Valley Authority in the establishment of an Inspector General. The Tennessee Valley Authority is included in the Inspector General Act of 1978 to prevent fraud, waste, and abuse in the Federal Government. Amendments add the Tennessee Valley Authority to the Executive Schedule Position and allow the current Inspector General to continue until a new appointment is made. The effective date for these changes is 30 days after the enactment of the Act. Establishment of Inspectors General Criminal Investigator Academy and Forensic Laboratory within the Department of the Treasury. The Criminal Investigator Academy provides training services for inspector general offices established under the Inspector General Act of 1978. It is administered by an Executive Director who reports to an inspector general designated by the President's Council on Integrity and Efficiency. Additionally, the Inspectors General Forensic Laboratory is established within the Department of the Treasury. The Inspectors General Forensic Laboratory, established within the Department of the Treasury, performs forensic services for inspector general offices. It is administered by an Executive Director who reports to an inspector general designated by the President's Council on Integrity and Efficiency or a majority vote of inspectors general. The United States Code is amended to include a separate appropriation account for the Inspectors General Criminal Investigator Academy and the Inspectors General Forensic Laboratory of the Department of the Treasury. Authorization of appropriations is provided for fiscal year 2001 and beyond.
